citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee was again unable to provide a written program of veterinary care at the time of inspection. A written program
of veterinary care is necessary to indicate that the care for both the health and well-being of all covered species is
provided.
Each exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangement shall include a written program of veterinary care and
regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the exhibitor.

The following area is still in need of cleaning:
The cavy enclosure, adjacent to the feed barn, still has a significant accumulation of feces and soil that is now about 8
inches deep throughout the enclosure. Excreta shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the
animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
There is one chicken present at this facility. All birds must be provided with environmental enhancement to promote their
psychological well-being. A written enrichment plan is not available for this chicken.
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. This plan must be made
available to APHIS upon request.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: SEPTEMBER 30, 2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee was again unable to provide a written program of veterinary care at the time of inspection. A written program 
of veterinary care is necessary to indicate that the care for both the health and well-being of all covered species is 
provided. 
 
Each exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending 
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangement shall include a written program of veterinary care and 
regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the exhibitor. 
3.131(a)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
The following area is still in need of cleaning: 
 
The cavy enclosure, adjacent to the feed barn, still has a significant accumulation of feces and soil that is now about 8 
inches deep throughout the enclosure. Excreta shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the 
animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
There is one chicken present at this facility. All birds must be provided with environmental enhancement to promote their 
psychological well-being. A written enrichment plan is not available for this chicken. 
 
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for 
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the 
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted 
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. This plan must be made 
available to APHIS upon request.  
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: SEPTEMBER 30, 2023

This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with licensee.
